questiontext.text:
The table shows in part the result of a one-factor ANOVA.

——– —- —- —- — Source df SS MS F Groups 3 Error 25 20 Total 28 35 ——– —- —- —- —

Given is the significance level of 0.05. Then it follows from the table that

answer.text: 4 ≤ F ≤ 5 and so the null hypothesis of ANOVA can be rejected.

feedback.text: 4 ≤ F ≤ 5 and thus the null hypothesis of ANOVA can be rejected…: Incorrect

answer.text: 6 ≤ F ≤ 7 and so the null hypothesis of ANOVA can be rejected.

feedback.text: 6 ≤ F ≤ 7 and thus the null hypothesis of ANOVA can be rejected: Correct

answer.text: F ≤ 2 and so the null hypothesis of ANOVA cannot be rejected.

feedback.text: F ≤ 2 and so the null hypothesis of ANOVA cannot be rejected: Incorrect
